intro: Callicoma stutzeri var. subpubescens, commonly known as the hairy-leaved callicoma, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy foliage. The leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape and have a rough texture due to the presence of fine pubescence. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish-yellow in color. This plant is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, shaded environments.
